div.pre: 1437 Asia Minor, c. 1964 Burial: c. 321 B.C. (M) Contents: 89+ AR Alexander III: lifetime and early post. dr. (Amphipolis 1 , Lampsacus 10 , Abydus 33 , Colophon 1 , Magnesia 22 , Miletus 11 , Sardes 10 , Ace 1 ) Disposition: New York and C. Hersh a few A record of the 89 coins detailed above is in the ANS The coin from Ace is dated yr. 22 (= 324 B.C.). The other coins are all struck before 321 with the exception of one coin from Abydus (= BMC 506) which is currently dated c. 307. The absence of drachms of Philip III is in favor of an early date and indicates that the single late coin is intrusive
